column4: How do I stop this error when I try to mount my external? ntfs-3g: Failed to access volume '/dev/sdb1': No such file or directory
run 'sudo fdisk -l' to check whether it's the right device
how were you trying to mount the partition?
check, and if it isn't, replace the /dev/foo  with whatever device you saw from the output of fdisk
you may also do 'sudo blkid' and use UUID=blahblahablah instead of /dev/..
no. change the device in /etc/fstab. it's wrong
'sudo fdisk -l' should display the device name for your ntfs partition.  replace /dev/sdb1 with that device name
the command i gave does it
